Home > SkyBridge® ProxyDLL

SkyBridge® ProxyDLL

The COVID pandemic brought many deep changes in our society, one of them is to work from home. The use of freelancer programmers over platforms such as Upwork can give software teams huge advantages.

However, one concern prevents many software teams from hiring freelancers, especially international: the safe-keeping of their intellectual property.

A software application often contains multiple components, some of which may contain valuable IP. Even if the freelancers only work on those that contains little IP, all the components need to be on their PCs for the project to compile and run.

Using the SkyBridge® ProxyDLL technology, in a few mouse clicks, the software team generates a proxy DLL from the original DLL that contains valuable IP, and gives the proxy DLL to the freelancers. The proxy DLL has the same public interface as the original DLL, therefore the freelancers’ project will compile and run.

Internally, the proxy DLL forwards every call on its functions to the eponymous functions in the original DLL, using the SkyBridge® instant remoting technology. The data return by the function in the original DLL is returned to the function in the proxy DLL, then to the caller. This way, in the eyes of its callers, the proxy DLL has the same behaviour as the original DLL.

More Details

The diagram shows how SkyBridge® ProxyDLL is used in a project with four components. DLL C and D contains valuable IP and cannot be given to the freelancer, so proxy DLL C’ and D’ are generated and given to the freelancer.

Generating the proxy DLLsCalling a function in proxy DLL C’Other use cases 
<DllMetadata Version="1.2">
  <PublicTypes>
    <PublicType Name="EmployeeDbAccessor" IsStatic="True">
      <PublicProperties>
        <PublicProperty>
        </PublicProperty>
      </PublicProperties>
      <PublicFunctions>
        <PublicFunction Name="GetEmployeeBirthday" IsStatic="True">
          <ReturnType>DateTime</ReturnType>
          <PublicParams>
            <Param Name="EmployeeId" Type="int"/>
          </PublicParams>
        </PublicFunction>
      </PublicFunctions>
    </PublicType>
  </PublicTypes>
</DLLMetadata>

Public metadata of a DLL

The metadata of a DLL includes all public types (i.e. classes) in the DLL. For each public type, it contains the name and type of all of its public properties and the name, input parameters and return type of all of its public functions.

The metadata also contains other public information about a DLL such as its version.

The extracted metadata is a XML which looks like this.
